biogHist.abstract: Doris Carter became Australia's first women's field athlete to compete at an Olympic Games when she placed sixth in the high jump at the 1936 Berlin Olympic Games. She also represented Australia in international hockey, and was General Manager of the Australian Women's Team at the Melbourne Olympic Games in 1956. A Wing Officer and Director of the Women's RAAF, she was the first woman to fly both the Canberra Bomber and the Vampire Jet. Her proudest moment was in 1996 shen she co-led the Melbourne ANZAC Day parade

chronItem.event: Teacher with the Victorian Education Department
Participated at the Berlin Olympic Games - Track and Field Athletics - placed sixth in the high jump
Represented Australia at the Empire Games, Sydney
Member of the Women's Auxiliary Australian Air Force (WAAAF)
Officer-in-charge of the WAAAF Victory Contingent to London
Officer-in-charge of the Child and Youth Migration with the Department of Immigration, London
Director of the Women's Royal Australian Air Force
President of the Australian Women's Amateur Athletic Union
Manager of the Australian Women's Team at the Olympic Games, Melbourne
Appointed Officer of the Order of the British Empire
General secretary of the YWCA, Melbourne
Member of the Board of Trustees at the Australian War Memorial, Canberra
Member of the National Fitness Council, Victoria

archref.abstract: Portrait of Squadron Officer Doris Carter, WAAAF, taken at her office desk at RAAF HQ, Victoria Barracks. Melbourne, Vic. C. 1944

resourceRelation.relationEntry: WAAAF members walking along a country road.

archref.unittitle: WAAAF members walking along a country road.
archref.abstract: WAAAF members walking along a country road. From left, Squadron Officer Margaret Blackwood; Grace Hunter; Group Officer Clare Stevenson (Director of the WAAAF); Patrica Burnard; Doris Carter. LOWER PLENTY, VIC, Physical description: Black & white Summary: LOWER PLENTY, VIC, 1944-07. WAAAF MEMBERS WALKING ALONG A COUNTRY ROAD. FROM LEFT, SQUADRON OFFICER MARGARET BLACKWOOD; GRACE HUNTER; GROUP OFFICER CLARE STEVENSON (DIRECTOR OF THE WAAAF); PATRICA BURNARD; DORIS CARTER.

In the outdoors, the Director WAAAF, Group Officer Clare Stevenson (second from left) and a WAAAF Wing Officer (in dark uniform) conversing with WAAAF officers who conducted a four-day bivouac for a group of WAAAF officer trainees in an area near Launching Place, as part of their training course. Third from the left is Squadron Officer Margaret Blackwood, the officer in charge of the bivouac and on the extreme right is Flight Officer Doris Carter, a staff instructor for the bivouac. On the latter's right is her assistant, Section Officer Helen Palmer.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Members of the Australian Victory Contingent on a visit to Berlin

archref.unittitle: Members of the Australian Victory Contingent on a visit to Berlin
archref.abstract: Members of the Australian Victory Contingent on a visit to Berlin, in front of Frederick the Great's Palace, 'Sans Souci', Potsdam. Pictured, left to right, foreground: A Petty Officer of the RAN; Squadron Leader P. Swan DFC; Flight Lieutenant P. Coffey DFC, RAAF; Major Joan L. Christie, Australian Army Medical Women's Service, and Squadron Officer Doris Carter, Women's Auxiliary Australian Air Force. Berlin, Germany. June 1946

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Eleanor Roosevelt speaking to a WAAAF Sergeant

archref.unittitle: Eleanor Roosevelt speaking to a WAAAF Sergeant
archref.abstract: Eleanor Roosevelt (centre) speaking to a WAAAF Sergeant during her inspection of the WAAAF Guard of Honour mounted on the occasion of Mrs Roosevelt's visit to Air Force Headquarters (AFHQ), Victoria Barracks. On the left is Flight Officer Doris Carter, the Officer-in-charge of the Guard of Honour. Melbourne, Vic. 1943-09.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: A WAAAF officer trainee prepares a meal over an open fire

archref.unittitle: A WAAAF officer trainee prepares a meal over an open fire
archref.abstract: A WAAAF officer trainee prepares a meal over an open fire during a four-day bivouac in an area near Launching Place as part of their training course. In the background is Flight Officer Doris Carter, one of the WAAAF instructors on the bivouac. Yarra Valley, Vic. C. 1943-09
